Package com.dougnoel.sentinel.pages

Class PageManager

java.lang.Object
com.dougnoel.sentinel.pages.PageManager
public class PageManager extends Object
The Page Manager is a singleton class that manages what page the test is on. Calling setPage with a string containing the name of the new page calls the Page Factory to create the new page (if it does not exist) and return it as a Page Object.

  • Method Details

    • driver

      private static org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver()

    • setPage

      public static void setPage(String pageName)
      This method sets a Page Object based on the class name passed to it. This allows us to operate on pages without knowing they exist when we write step definitions.
      Parameters:
      pageName - String Must be an exact string match (including case) to the Page Object name (e.g. LoginPage).

    • getPage

      public static Page getPage()
      This method returns the current Page Object stored in the Page Manager.
      Returns:
      Page the Page Object

    • open

      public static void open(String pageName, String arguments)
      Creates a WebDriver if it doesn't exist and opens up the webpage or application.
      Parameters:
      pageName - String the name of the page object to open
      arguments - String the arguments to pass as a query string if this is a web page

    • waitForPageLoad

      public static boolean waitForPageLoad() throws InterruptedException
      Sets page load timeout on web driver instance using the timeout and timeunit values set in the configuration file or on the command line. Then interfaces with isPageLoaded to continually test if a page is loaded until it returns true or times out.
      Returns:
      boolean always returns true, will throw exception if page does not load
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the thread gets interrupted
      See Also:
      • isPageLoaded()

    • isPageLoaded

      private static boolean isPageLoaded()
      Returns true if document.readyState is complete for the current non-windows-application driver, meaning the page has loaded successfully. Uses the driver's pageLoadTimeout setting to throw a TimeoutException if the body element cannot be found on the page.
      Returns:
      boolean true if page has loaded or the page is a windows application, false if not.

    • getCurrentPageObjectType

      public static PageObjectType getCurrentPageObjectType()
      Returns what the page Manager believes to be the current page object type. Will return WEBPAGE, EXECUTABLE, or UNKNOWN if we don't know. This value is set every time a new webpage or executable is opened using the PageManager.open() method.
      Returns:
      PageObjectType the type of page we are on
